instructions: You are assisting with Riflebird, an AI-powered test generation and execution framework supporting unit, integration, E2E, visual, and performance testing. Follow strict TypeScript conventions: use `type` not `interface`, export all types, no `any` types, use type guards for validation. Optimize for O(1)/O(log n) complexity - avoid O(nÂ²), use Maps/Sets instead of nested loops. Follow TDD: write tests before implementation (Red-Green-Refactor). See .ai/rules.md for complete guidelines.

rules.instruction: Use `type` instead of `interface`. Export all types. No `any` types - use `unknown` with type guards. Avoid `as unknown as` casting. Export named types for public APIs.
Follow TDD: write failing test first, implement minimal code to pass, refactor. One assertion concept per test. Descriptive names using Given/When/Then. Mock external dependencies.
Use Zod for validation. Type inference via z.infer. Never hardcode API keys - use process.env.
Implement TestFrameworkAdapter interface. Playwright: programmatic execution. Cypress: code generation only.
